CatDescriptText: Mr. James Traynor, newsdealer, Downtown, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 5, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "If you were advising a Negro high school student, who plans to enter college and is seeking help on choosing a vocation, what field would you suggest that he or she seek as a vocation?" Answer reads: "There is no question about it, we are in great need of scientists and, since we need 'em so badly, my first advice to a college-bound student, at this time, would be to study hard in the field of science.  We know the Russians have on a big program in this field, and we must match them or wind up far behind."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James Traynor wearing cap and zippered jacket, standing in front of streetlight, car, and building with sign that reads "...adio"
